Package online.game

This package contains everything a to support actual games.

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
BaseBoard.BoardState  
BoardProtocol this is the visible contract between "board" objects and the general parts of the game system.
commonMove.MoveFilter  
GameLayoutClient  
Play2Constants a collection of constants appropriate for 2 player games, but not appropriate for games with more players.
Play6Constants  
PlayConstants a collections of constants for use by game viewers.
ViewerProtocol Technically speaking, an add-on game for boardspace only needs to implement ViewerProtocol.
ViewGameProtocol these protocol items are normally of concern only to the Game class.
 

Class Summary
BaseBoard this is the recommended lowest level class for Boardspace boards.
ccell<FINALTYPE extends ccell<FINALTYPE>> some legacy or simple games use just a "char" to indicate the contents of the cell.
cell<FINALTYPE extends cell<FINALTYPE>> this is the common cell which can be used by all boards.
chip<T> this is the base class for "chips" which are objects typically placed on boards.
chipCell<FINALTYPE extends chipCell<FINALTYPE,COMPONENTTYPE>,COMPONENTTYPE extends chip<?>> this is the principal subclass of cell for cells whose contents is just a single object.
circBoard<CELLTYPE extends cell<CELLTYPE>> Base class for boards with radial symmetry.
commonCanvas This class extends exCanvas and provides a bunch of services for the individual game's Viewer class.
commonMove this class is the basis for representing individual moves in the game.
CommonMoveStack  
commonMPMove this is a suitable base class for the "move" class of games which have more than 2 players.
commonPlayer this class holds information about players.
dummyMove this is a class used to insert messages into the raw move history of a game.
Game todo: fix "scoring rejected" caused when players reconnect after game over todo: fix "save game failed" caused by too fast games.
GameLayoutManager this is the expert for constructing board layouts.
gBoard<CELLTYPE extends cell<CELLTYPE>>  
hexBoard<CELLTYPE extends cell<CELLTYPE>> support for generic hex boards in various convex shapes, including coordinate system transforms and drawing functions.
HiddenGameWindow hidden game windows, show the private information for players.
RBoard<CELLTYPE extends cell<CELLTYPE>> a board where the cells have random locations, not in a regular grid.
RcBoard a board-like class where the cells have random coordinates instead of being in a grid.
rectBoard<CELLTYPE extends cell<CELLTYPE>> the generic part of all rectangular boards with diagonal connections
RepeatedPositions  
square_geo_board<CELLTYPE extends cell<CELLTYPE>> common support for square geometry boards with connections in 2 4 or 8 directions.
squareBoard<CELLTYPE extends cell<CELLTYPE>> support a square board with no diagonal links.
stackCell<FINALTYPE extends stackCell<FINALTYPE,COMPONENTTYPE>,COMPONENTTYPE extends chip<?>> stackCell extends cell with a stack of chips.
trackBoard<CELLTYPE extends cell<CELLTYPE>> Implement a one dimensional board with a race track around the edges, like a monopoly board.
triBoard<CELLTYPE extends cell<CELLTYPE>> support for generic triangular grid boards.
 

Enum Summary
cell.Geometry Geometry is the number of neighbors a cell has.
commonCanvas.MovementStyle movement style for an animation.
commonCanvas.VcrId the vcr slider cluster uses these Ids.
commonMove.EStatus  
gBoard.DrawingStyle values for drawing_style determine how the board is drawn around the grid points.
PlayConstants.GameId HitNoWhere is used as the code for "nothing hit yet".
PlayConstants.Itype board cell iterator types.
replayMode replayMode serves as advice to control saving animation information or not
 

Package online.game Description

This package contains everything a to support actual games. The interface of a particular game will be a "viewer" class which implements ViewerProtocol package online.game;

Author:
ddyer
